title: OER-Integrated Mathematics Online Course Design: Intermediate Practitioner Program

context.prior_knowledge: Grasp of secondary-level mathematics concepts and workplace data analysis experience
context.additional_context: Blended learning conducted in a BYOD (Bring Your Own Device) environment using an OER (Open Educational Resources) platform, with job-linked project execution.

learning_goals: Students can design mathematical modeling procedures for solving workplace problems using OER (Open Educational Resources) materials.
A design-based research (DBR) methodology is applied to propose an OER-integrated instructional design framework.
Learner-tailored OER mathematics content is developed according to interaction design principles.
Through project-based assessment, students develop data analysis solutions applicable to real-world workplace scenarios.

resources: Access to Mathematics-Specialized OER Content Library

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
